title: Weingut Liebfrauenstift 2009 Wormser Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: A good everyday Syrah. It doesn't show the richness of the single-vineyard bottlings, but it's nice and dry, with berry, cherry, grilled meat, pepper and oak flavors.
title: Jaffurs 2009 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Soft aromas of vanilla, melon and peach give this wine a pretty, subdued air. Appealing to fans of lighter whites, the wine still has a floral, filled out character that will pair well with spicy ethnic cuisine and sweeter fish dishes.
title: Kouros 2008 Roditis (Patras)

description: Stainless-steel fermentation yields a tangy, ripe, tart, tongue-tickling Gewurztraminer with exceptional minerality. The echoing varietal flavors of flower and rosewater add interest to the finish. Still a bit yeasty, but should improve with a little more bottle age.
title: Lumos 2009 Temperance Hill Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Willamette Valley)

description: Medium-intense aromas of black cherry and berry appear first, followed by lovely accents of orange blossom florals and sweet licorice spice. A touch of leather unfolds on the finish. Medium weight and balanced with approachable tannins and an easy-drinking structure.
title: Mas des Mas 2008 Red (Minervois)

description: Thin and green flavors dominate this Cabernet Franc. Small amounts of Merlot and Petit Verdot do not seem to have made an impact. It's sharp, stiff, and quite herbal.
title: Capstone Cellars 2009 Boushey Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: This wine seems barely ripe, with thin, herbal, almost vegetal flavors and a sour streak. The barrel aging may have contributed some suggestions of vanilla and licorice.
title: Cave B 2010 Estate Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Another 2010 Pinot marred by vegetal aromas. The chilly vintage took its toll, robbing the raspberries and cherries of their natural richness. Still, it's pretty good once you give it some airing.
title: Bargetto 2010 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: An oily popcorn aroma is neither fresh nor lively. The palate is wide and mouthfilling, with notes of bitter almond and creamy citrus. It's viscous on the finish, but there's not much flavor or character.
title: Beldui 2011 Txakolina White (Spain)

description: Aromas of white gum drop and funky yeast set up a slightly cloying palate, with a candied flavor of pear. It transitions to notes of banana, mango and powdered sugar on the finish. A blend of Malvasia and Viura.
title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2011 Diamante Semi Dulce White (Rioja)

description: Jammy and tart in acidity, with green mint and white pepper flavors alongside riper ones of raspberries, this is a Zinfandel that's easy to drink with burgers, and it can even take a slight chill in the fridge.
title: Bota Box 2011 Zinfandel (California)

description: Okay for everyday drinking, but a little soft and heavy, with sweet, jammy raspberry flavors and a touch of green unripeness. It's also hot in the finish.
title: Deep Sea 2010 Solomon Hills Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Generic red fruit and milk chocolate aromas precede a tangy palate with a fairly high acid-to-body ratio. This tastes of tart red plum, with a hint of chocolate; it's short, crisp and quaffable. Novo Imports and Aidil Wines & Liquors.
title: Federico Paternina 2010 Clisos  (Rioja)

description: Scratchy berry and rubber aromas roll into a grabby, aggressive palate, with a burnt note and resiny oak overshadowing a berry flavor. The finish is rubbery and chunky.
title: Montebuena 2010 Cuvée KPF  (Rioja)

description: Soft, easy acids set up the lissome mouthfeel, which is dominated by a note of cinnamon-spiced prune. The prune quality is also apparent on the nose, joined by a smoky liquid-oak tone and minor inflections of tobacco and turmeric.
title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2010 Rhapsody in Red Red (Shenandoah Valley)

description: This shows apple and pear flavors in a soft shell of a body. The finish is light and gently fragrant.
title: Wunsch & Mann 2011 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: This has a saturated purple color, with aromas that are green, inky and grassy. Supertannic and drawing in feel, it has black fruit and chocolate flavors that come across pushy, sweet and hot. It's as bold as they come, but it lacks elegance and harmony.
title: Finca 8 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: A healthy mix of boysenberries and strawberry preserves form the core aromas, with touches of spiced toast and purple flower. Delicate tannins lend the palate an open feel, and a green streak cuts through the center. The flavors would benefit from a boost of concentration.
title: Gadino 2010 Antiche Viti Reserva Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

description: Surprisingly, in the blind lineup, Ingleside's regular bottling of Merlot fared slightly better than its Reserve bottling of the same vintage. Overall, this is a supple wine, with flavors of chocolate-covered cherry and clove as well as a note of pear drop that cuts through the core.
title: Ingleside 2007 Merlot (Virginia)

description: A light, pale raspberry flavor seems to run a mile wide and an inch deep. Seeming slightly sugary, this just doesn't have any weight.
title: Martinez & Martinez 2009 Dominio de Martinez Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This has briary, herbal aromas and a sweet beet note. It is syrupy and sappy, with candied cassis and black cherry flavors.
title: Viña Cobos 2011 Felino Merlot (Mendoza)

description: Ripe and oaky, with raspberry and cherry jam, mushroom and oak flavors that have a dry finish. Drink now.
title: R2 2010 Big Bend Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This is mulchy on the nose, with a compost aroma muddling up the red-fruit component. It feels lean and scouring, with cranberry, tart raspberry and vanilla flavors. The finish is fragmented and stalky.
title: Ramón Bilbao 2009  Rioja

description: Thin and simple, dry and sharp, this has modest cherry, black pepper and mint flavors. Still, it has enough fruit to drink with a nice burger.
title: Redtree 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Packaged in an easy screwcap bottle, this wine (made from equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon) is bright, linear and crisp, with notes of cherry cola and grape juice.
title: Ricci Curbastro 2011 Red (Sebino)

description: Subtle notes of peanut shell, brioche, wet wool and apple juice form the nose, leading to a palate that veers toward the light side, tasting a bit washed out.
title: Running Brook 2010 Pinot Gris (Southeastern New England)

description: Gaseous and rubbery on the nose, this is overpowered by a tire aroma and heavily reduced berry scents. It feels thick and ultrajammy, with overwhelming berry flavors in front of a heavy, hot finish.
title: Stylo 2009 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: Toasted, smoky oak is the dominant aroma, veneering the herb-tinged raspberry and dark cherry notes. Drying tannins frame the shallow flavors, and the cranberry-like acidity adds tartness to the light- to medium-bodied palate.
title: General's Ridge 2011 Merlot (Virginia)

description: This is perfumed and lemony, almost to the point of resembling furniture polish. It's pleasantly silky in texture, but the recurring notes of white pepper and citrus become somewhat one-dimensional and slightly bitter on the finish.
title: Vignobles de Balma Venitia 2011 Domaine du Paparotier  (Muscat de Beaumes de Venise)

description: A dusty cherry aroma turns harsh with airing, setting up a tight, acidic palate that's marked by tart raspberry and plum flavors. Scouring, spicy and peppery on the finish, this amounts to a tight, hard and basic Rioja.
title: Bodegas Ontañón 2008 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: This Bordeaux-style blend enters with a sharp, tannic, rough-hewn mouthfeel. The fruit may be ripe enough, but the hot finish makes it difficult to taste.
title: Capstone Cellars 2009 Boushey Vineyard Banere Red (Yakima Valley)

description: This tastes like an alcoholic fruit drink with apricot, orange and mango flavors. Still, it's clean and pleasant.
title: Jenica Peak 2011 Coastal Series Chardonnay (California)

description: Shy, timid notes of white peach and tropical fruit are offset by hints of vanilla and nutty biscuit. It feels medium to full bodied, but this lacks intensity and concentration overall. A touch of spice on the midpalate adds interest.
title: Keswick Vineyards 2011 Chardonnay (Monticello)

description: This is a simple North Coast Cabernet with herbal and green olive and pepper tones.
title: Line 39 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: This doesn't taste quite ripe, with vegetal flavors marring the raspberry and cherry notes. Otherwise, it shows a softly tannic mouthfeel.
title: Tercero 2009 Camp 4 Vineyard Mourvèdre (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Zesty lemon and lime aromas add elegance to unctuous white peach and apricot flavors on this delicate, yet remarkably complex wine. Off-dry in style, it balances a youthful fruit profile with nuanced shades of smoke and earth. Nervy citrus acidity drives a long, focused finish.
designation: Nik Weis Wiltinger Alte Reben Ortswein Kabinett Feinherb
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2012 Nik Weis Wiltinger Alte Reben Ortswein Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

description: Distinctive aromatic qualities mark this afforable bottling, an exclusive for Hawaiian supermarket chain Foodland from the team at Terravant Wine Company in Buellton. The aromas recall chaparral scrub, mint tea and black sage. The herbaceousness continues on the palate, with a sticky tannic structure. Not exactly the wine for those seeking a red fruit experience, but good for those seeking the savory side of the grape.
title: Ternion 2011 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine shows the riper, spicier side to German Pinot Noir. Lush black cherry and plum flavors are fleshy and dense on the palate, tinged with notes of cassis and bramble. Crisp acidity adds elegance and structure, along with a penetrating layer of finely textured tannins. Drink now for its bold, decadent style.
title: Thörle 2011 Saulheimer Kalkstein Trocken Spätburgunder (Rheinhessen)
